intro: Acropogon mesophilus, commonly known as the mesophilic acropogon, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, erect growth habit. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, typical of grass family members. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires moderate to high levels of sunlight. Acropogon mesophilus is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
